instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00244 Not powering on
threads.message: 820-00244 Not powering on and i found out C3101 is shorted to ground so i replaced it and got a faint light on D6900 but still no boot no display and cpu not getting warm, i then tested PPBUS_LIO and got 14v and as far as i know this suppose to be a 20v, replace U3100 or Q3100?

threads.title: 820-00244 Not powering on
threads.message: 5 or 20 volts on DC-in? I will warn you all 12" MacBooks end in dead CPU at some point, so beware.

threads.title: 820-00244 Not powering on
threads.message:
14V could be correct, depending of charger model.
Post exact voltage for PPDCIN_G3H and PPBUS_G3H.
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?
Be aware of CPU short life on these boards.

threads.title: 820-00244 Not powering on
threads.message:
Check if PM_SLP_SUS_L misses too.
If not present, check all RTC signals (3).

threads.title: 820-00244 Not powering on
threads.message:
Can you post ALL RTC signals measured???
Also post PM_RSMRST_L, PM_PWRBTN_L, PM_BATLOW_L, PM_DSW_PWRGD.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L (R5225/26 pads) and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: 820-00244 Not powering on
threads.message:
PM_RSMRST_L = 0v
PM_PWRBTN_L = 0v
PM_BATLOW_L = 0v
PM_DSW_PWRGD = 1.2v
SMC_ONOFF_L = 3.3v
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.09v
SYSCLK_CLK32K_PCH = 0.5v
PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.09v
PCH_RTCRST_L = 3.09v
PCH_INTRUDER_L = 2.78v

threads.title: 820-00244 Not powering on
threads.message:
OK, RTC signals all good.

"PM_DSW_PWRGD = 1.2v"
This is bad; check S5_PWRGD.
Also check around U7800, PP3V3_PMICLDO, SMC_PM_G2_EN, PP5V_G3H.

threads.title: 820-00244 Not powering on
threads.message: As i was testing S5_PWRGD which is 3.3v i notice the cpu is warm so put back the lcd and it booted but after i shut it down and turn it back on, no boot and display, a loose component maybe? reflow?

threads.title: 820-00244 Not powering on
threads.message: Many times CPU gets bent and this generates bad solders on the balls from the edges...
